fields.title: Indice del Libro doce de Bautismos de pardos y morenos, 1853 - 1861
fields.creator: National Endowment for the Humanities Collaborative Research Grant; Rafael de Medina
subject: Marriages
Cuba
fields.description: This volume contains baptisms from June 24th, 1853 to May 21st, 1861. There is a note wrote on July 24th, 1874 about the time record for the baptisms but seems like the first record is missing. There is also another note (with the letterhead "Valga para el sello 2°: 12 reales") from the very priests in charge of all the baptisms, Rafael de Medina, who wrote the following: "Certifico que este libro firmado para asentar las partidas de bautismos de las personas de los que se bautizen en la feligresía de esta Iglesia de mi cargo, consta de trescientas noventa y seis fojas útiles, sin enmiendas ni folios, y segun lo prevenido por  su Illustrisima en la Circular N° 42 pongo la presente Iglesia Parroquial de término de Jesús María y José, veinte de junio de mil ochocientos años. Rafael de Medina [signature]" Fair condition

subject: Marriages
Cuba
fields.description: This volume contains baptisms from November 17th, 1867 to  February 21tst, 1876. There is the following note wrote on November 17th, 1867: "Don Rafael de Medina Cura Beneficiado por [ ] de la Iglesia Parroquial de Termino de Jesus Maria y Jose de esta ciudad de la Habana Cuba. Certifico que este libro 14 destinado a asentar partidas de Bautismos de Pardos y Morenos, consta de trescuebtis diez y nueve fojas utiles sin enmiendas en sus folios segun lo prevenido por Su Ilustrisima en la Circular No 42 pongo la presente Iglesia Parroquial de Termino de Jesus Maria y Jose diez y siete de Noviembre de mil ochocientos sesenta y siete anos." fields.title: Inventário de Libros de Bautismos de Pardos y Morenos, 2003
fields.creator: National Endowment for the Humanities Collaborative Research Grant; Padre Miguel Ángel Moral Villa
subject: Inventory
Cuba
fields.description: The volume consists of two letters and a handwritten inventory of the books of baptisms of  "pardos y morenos" held in the Iglesia de Santo Cristo del Buen Viaje. The letter dated 24 April 2003 is an inquiry from the Archbishopric of Havana addressed to the Iglesia de Santo Cristo del Buen Viaje concerning the number of books of baptisms dedicated to "negros" and the total number of individuals baptized within them. In the letter dated 16 May 2003, Padre Miguel Ángel Moral Villa informs the Archbishopric that the Buen Viaje church holds 48 books of baptisms of individuals of color, documenting approximately 44,062 baptisms. He also writes that most of the pages of books 1-5, corresponding to the years 1702-1755, are "pegado" (stuck together) and in poor condition. Good condition
fields.institution: Iglesia del Santo Cristo del Buen Viaje

fields.title: Suplemento de Bautismos de Pardos y Morenos, 1831-1846
fields.creator: National Endowment for the Humanities Collaborative Research Grant
subject: Baptisms
Cuba
fields.description: During his 1853 visit to the Iglesia de Nuestra Señora del Pilar, Bishop Don Francisco Hein y Solano examined the parish's volumes of baptismal records of pardos and morenos. Hein y Solano found that while Libros 4 onward were in good shape, the volumes compiled by preceding priests (corresponding to Libros 1 and 2) were "in great disorder." This volume consists of entries  that were copied from Libros 1 and 2 following Hein y Solano's visitation due to errors in numeration or which were missing from those volumes. The entries date from 1831, 1837-1838, 1842, 1844, and 1845-1846. Good condition
fields.institution: Iglesia de Nuestra Señora del Pilar de Cimarrones

fields.title: Religiones Africanas, 1844-1904
fields.creator: National Endowment for the Humanities Collaborative Research Grant
subject: Police records
African religions
Cuba
fields.description: Various correspondence dating from the mid- to late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries between police officials regarding various men accused of belonging to illegal Afro-Cuban associations, such as Abakuá (ñañiguismo), and of practicing sorcery. The earliest correspondence preserved here concerns an enslaved man accused of stealing gunpowder for use in sorcery and dates from 1844. Fair condition
fields.institution: Archivo Histórico Provincial de Matanzas

fields.title: Correspondencias sobre Cimarrones de la Provincia de Matanzas, 1785-1843
fields.creator: National Endowment for the Humanities Collaborative Research Grant
subject: Marriages
Cuba
fields.description: This volume contains various collections of correspondence regarding runaway slaves in the province of Matanzas. Manuscripts in the collection include some of the following: letters to the governor of Matanzas, lists of escaped slaves from plantation estates, and information about palenques, or settlements, of runaway slaves.  Plantations mentioned include some of the following: Ingenio San Francisco; Ingenio San Isidro Labrador y Monserrate; Ingenio Atrevido; Ingenio Santo Domingo.  Good condition, Tattered pages, Some blurred photos
fields.institution: Archivo Historico Provincial de Matanzas

fields.title: Sublevaciones, 1843
fields.creator: National Endowment for the Humanities Collaborative Research Grant
subject: Criminal records
Cuba
fields.description: Comunicaciones acera de sumaria instruída contra los morenos Nicasio Fabris y María de Regla Andraes, denunciados por Don José Frio, al parecer en relación con los sucesos de Cárdenas y Bemba. 2 de abril al 7 de diciembre de 1843. Comunicaciones sobre acuerdo de la Junta Superior de Propios y Arbitrios sobre costo del cadalso y ejecución del negro Eusebio Cabreses. 14 de julio de 1843. Comunicación al Gobernador de Matanzas sobre el Capitan del partido de Santa Ana solicitando continuar los 10 días que le faltan de la licencia que interrumpio por la sublevación del Ingenio Triunvirato. 18 de noviembre de 1843. Comunicación al Teniente Gobernador de Alacranes sobre fuga del negro Lucas Gangá que había cumplido condena de 4 años, con ramel y grillete, por participar en la Conspiración de 1843. Firma Juan Bautista Rosquín. 28 de enero de 1843.  Fair condition, Smudged or bleeding ink
fields.institution: Archivo Histórico Provincial de Matanzas
